docs.title: Welcome to Mkdocs Tutorial Project
docs.text: This is a sample project to demonstrate MkDocs with Markdown, Jupyter notebooks, and navigation.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Markdown support
  • Jupyter notebook integration
  • Material theme
  • Code highlighting

Check out the Getting Started guide to begin your journey!

docs.title: Advanced Topics
docs.text:
In [1]: Copied! 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title('Sine Wave')
plt.xlabel('x')
plt.ylabel('sin(x)')
plt.show()
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100) y = np.sin(x) plt.plot(x, y) plt.title('Sine Wave') plt.xlabel('x') plt.ylabel('sin(x)') plt.show()

This example shows how to create a simple plot using matplotlib within a Jupyter notebook.

docs.title: Advanced Topics¶
docs.text: This notebook demonstrates how to include Jupyter notebooks in your MkDocs project.

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: This is a sample API reference page. In a real project, you would document your API endpoints, functions, or classes here.

docs.title: Sample Function
docs.text:
def greet(name: str) -> str:
    """
    Returns a greeting message for the given name.

    Args:
        name (str): The name to greet.

    Returns:
        str: A greeting message.
    """
    return f"Hello, {name}!"

docs.title: Sample Class
docs.text:
class Calculator:
    """A simple calculator class."""

    def add(self, a: float, b: float) -> float:
        """
        Add two numbers.

        Args:
            a (float): The first number.
            b (float): The second number.

        Returns:
            float: The sum of a and b.
        """
        return a + b

    def subtract(self, a: float, b: float) -> float:
        """
        Subtract one number from another.

        Args:
            a (float): The number to subtract from.
            b (float): The number to subtract.

        Returns:
            float: The difference between a and b.
        """
        return a - b

This page demonstrates how to document functions and classes in your API reference.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
To get started with this project, follow these steps:

  1. Clone the repository
  2. Install the requirements:
pip install -r requirements.txt
  1. Run MkDocs:
mkdocs serve
  1. Open your browser and go to http://localhost:8000

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: Explore the Advanced Topics to learn more about using Jupyter notebooks with MkDocs.
